title: Life-friendly molecules are leaking out of Jupiter's giant moon Europa, Galileo images hint
summary: A new finding of ammonia on the icy surface of Jupiter's moon Europa could have important implications for the search for extraterrestrial life.

title: 'Behemoth star,' previously thought to be dying, is 'rising from the ashes' like a pheonix
summary: A new study suggests that the red supergiant WOH G64, also known as the "behemoth star," has not transitioned into a yellow hypergiant as previous research suggested. This means it is now unlikely to imminently explode in a colossal supernova.

title: New map shows weird magnetic anomaly lurking beneath Australia's Northern Territory
summary: Advanced modeling has revealed an Australia-shaped magnetic anomaly beneath the country's Northern Territory that holds valuable information about Australia's geological history.

title: 'Textbooks will need to be updated': Jupiter is smaller and flatter than we thought, Juno spacecraft reveals
summary: Jupiter is smaller and flatter than scientists previously thought, new measurements of the gas giant reveal.

title: Grim photo captures polar bear mom and cubs resting in mud in summer heat
summary: An image of polar bears napping along the Hudson Bay coast in Canada has been shortlisted for the Wildlife Photographer of the Year Nuveen People's Choice Award 2026.

title: A deer carrying the rotting head of its vanquished foe and a playful lynx shortlisted for Wildlife Photographer of the Year Nuveen People's Choice Award
summary: Here are the 24 images shortlisted for the Wildlife Photographer of the Year Nuveen People's Choice Award 2026.

title: NIH rolls back red tape on some experiments — spurring excitement and concern
summary:
Nature, Published online: 04 February 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00337-x

Some human research will no longer be classified as a clinical trial, easing the paperwork burden, but not everyone agrees with the approach.
body: Nature, Published online: 04 February 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00337-x Some human research will no longer be classified as a clinical trial, easing the paperwork burden, but not everyone agrees with the approach.

title: An ‘Intimacy Crisis’ Is Driving the Dating Divide
summary: In his book The Intimate Animal, sex and relationships researcher Justin Garcia says people have miscalculated their need for human intimacy, which is the real issue at the root of the loneliness epidemic.

title: Asteroid 2024 YR4's collision with the moon could create a flash visible from Earth, study finds
summary: If the building-size asteroid 2024 YR4 crashes into the moon in December 2032, the impact will produce a bright flash that may be visible to the naked eye, a new study finds.

title: In the search for bees, Mozambique honey hunters and birds share a language with distinct, regional dialects
summary: People searching for honey in Mozambique work with birds via a shared language in a rare case of cooperation between humans and wild animals. This language also comes with regional dialects — that appear to be driven by the birds.

title: Physicists push thousands of atoms to a 'Schrödinger's cat' state — bringing the quantum world closer to reality than ever before
summary: Researchers have demonstrated that a nanoparticle of 7,000 sodium atoms can act as a wave, creating a record-setting superposition.

title: شجاعة استثنائية.. سبح ساعات في عرض البحر لإنقاذ أسرته
summary: أشاد عناصر الإنقاذ الأستراليون بشجاعة فتى مراهق سبح لأربع ساعات وسط الأمواج قبالة سواحل أستراليا بحثا عمّن ينقذ عائلته.

title: Now is not the time to defund human fetal tissue research
summary:
Nature, Published online: 03 February 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00308-2

Hindering studies involving fetal tissue will impede the development of the alternatives intended to replace it, while slowing the search for new medicin…
body: Nature, Published online: 03 February 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00308-2 Hindering studies involving fetal tissue will impede the development of the alternatives intended to replace it, while slowing the search for new medicines.

title: I know science can’t fix the world — here’s why I do it anyway
summary:
Nature, Published online: 03 February 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00310-8

The world faces energy shortages as fossil fuels are phased out. Research can’t go on as normal.
body: Nature, Published online: 03 February 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00310-8 The world faces energy shortages as fossil fuels are phased out. Research can’t go on as normal.

title: Auroras likely as most active sunspot in years turns toward Earth
summary: The sunspot region 4366 fired off dozens of powerful solar flares in 24 hours, including the single strongest flare since 2024. Auroras are possible later this week.

title: لصلته بإبستين.. استقالة سياسي بريطاني من "حزب العمال"
summary: قال السياسي البريطاني بيتر ماندلسون إنه استقال من عضوية حزب العمال لتجنب التسبب للحزب في "مزيد من الإحراج" عقب تكشف معلومات جديدة حول صداقته مع جيفري إبستين.

title: Don’t talk science, play science: translate your data into music to improve its reach
summary:
Nature, Published online: 02 February 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00316-2

Data sonification helps researchers to build connections and communicate their science to a broader audience.
body: Nature, Published online: 02 February 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00316-2 Data sonification helps researchers to build connections and communicate their science to a broader audience.

title: 'It's similar to how Google can map your home without your consent': Why using aerial lasers to map an archaeology site should have Indigenous partnership
summary: Aerial lidar is transforming how archaeologists map sites, but they should do it in tandem with Indigenous people.

title: A New Hostess Spring Snack Lineup Is On The Way & Fans Are Already Calling Dibs
summary: People are already mentally clearing shelf space.

title: Rare medieval seal discovered in UK is inscribed with 'Richard's secret' and bears a Roman-period gemstone
summary: The Gosfield seal is made of a medieval silver seal bezel surrounding an ancient Roman gemstone.

title: Stellar nursery bursts with newborn stars in hauntingly beautiful Hubble telescope image — Space photo of the week
summary: A new image from NASA's Hubble Space Telescope shows the Lupus 3 cloud in Scorpius bursting with young stars that are forming within collapsing clouds of gas and dust.

title: When were boats invented?
summary: The oldest physical boat is a canoe from roughly 10,000 years ago, but evidence suggests humans have been using watercraft for at least 50,000 years.

title: صدمة للدروس الخصوصية.. إقبال على حصص الإنترنت بمصر
summary: تتلقى الدروس الخصوصية صدمة قوية في مصر حاليا، مع تزايد الإقبال بشكل ملحوظ حصص التعليم عبر الإنترنت، والصفحات الخاصة بعدد من مشاهير المعلمين عبر مواقع التواصل الاجتماعي، وموقع "يوتيوب"، والتي تقدم الخدمات المجانية للطلاب من مراحل التعليم المختلفة.

title: Life may have rebounded 'ridiculously fast' after the dinosaur-killing asteroid impact
summary: After the asteroid smashed into Earth around 66 million years ago, it didn't take life that long to rebound, a new study finds.

title: James Webb telescope solves mystery of 'forever young' vampire stars from the dawn of time
summary: Astronomers have discovered how "forever young" stars stay blue and bright despite being almost as old as the universe.

title: How long does it take the sun to rotate?
summary: The time it takes for the sun to completely rotate depends where on the sun you are measuring.

title: 'Part of the evolutionary fabric of our societies': Same-sex sexual behavior in primates may be a survival strategy, study finds
summary: A new study comparing 59 species of primates linked same-sex sexual behavior to scarce resources and more predators in socially complex species. The findings show diverse sexual behaviors are common — and likely beneficial in primates.

title: More than 43,000 years ago, Neanderthals spent centuries collecting animal skulls in a cave; but archaeologists aren't sure why
summary: Neanderthals repeatedly returned to the cave to store horned animal skulls, revealing this cultural tradition was transmitted over time.

title: دمية "الحصان الباكي" تحصد الإعجاب في الصين
summary: في مدينة ييوو للتجارة الدولية، أكبر سوق للجملة في الصين، يتزاحم الزبائن في متجر صغير بحثا عن سلعة رائجة بشكل غير متوقع قبل حلول السنة القمرية الجديدة.

title: سباق مع الزمن.. عشرات طُمروا تحت "جبل نفايات" في الفلبين
summary: يواصل عناصر الإنقاذ، السبت، مستخدمين الجرافات عمليات البحث عن ناجين بين أكوام القمامة عقب انهيار مكب نفايات في وسط الفلبين، مما أدى إلى دفن عشرات من عمال النظافة ومقتل ستة منهم على الأقل.
